alert.note: Alert for Bayfield (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 2:22AM CST until January 17 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches for northern Bayfield county. Less than an inch of additional snow expected elsewhere. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Bayfield County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Red Cliff Band. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest snow accumulations are expected north and east of County Highway C in the higher elevations of Bayfield County.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
